website_summaries.verdict: A simple, affordable scanner for basic jobs that can easily support multiple devices.
pros: This compact scanner features a touchscreen LCD, making it easy to use and configure
The document feeder quickly works through multiple pages
cons: Does not scan directly to cloud storage
Images may be somewhat misaligned or tilted

website_summaries.verdict: The Brother ADS-1700W is a fast and accurate portable document scanner that offers a slew of features that will be attractive to road warriors.

customer_reviews.title: Does not scan directly to cloud services wirelessly
customer_reviews.text: The description, and even Brothers website, claims wireless scanning directly to Cloud Services (Google, iCloud, Box, etc). Once I received this devices, I tried to do just that. However, 30 minutes of Brother tech support has proven this feature claim to be a lie. This device DOES NOT SCAN TO CLOUD SERVICES WIRELESSLY!! You can, however, scan to their installed software on your computer - then, you can transfer your scanned items to various cloud services. This is completely useless as it requires a computer. Why even offer the functionality if I need my computer to which I could have done it in the first place? ** Returning the scanner today **
customer_reviews.author: Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nifty scanner; very likable; crooked pages
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was unimpressed with the way the item shipped, no extra boxing just a label on the printer box, fortunately despite taking several hits the unit seems to be OK. This nifty little scanner is compact and easy to use. Had no issues connecting to WiFi and was able to scan directly from the phone app. The phone app is OK but you cannot name or rename file scans which means extra work of finding the file and renaming it. I was happy with the scanning speed. It scans double sided with one pass through, which I love. Only complaint so far is the pages struggle to stay straight, which is a big minus.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and extremely cheap product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how cheap this product is made. Right out of the box there was a loose part that fell off from the ADF area. Could not put it back in place despite having technical background myself. I called the Brother customer care, sent them a picture of the piece and after placing me on hold for 45 min, all they said is that part can come loose very easily and provided me instructions on how to put it back in place, but the instructions and pictures are not detailed or easy to follow. Horrible experience
customer_reviews.author: Raymond 2015

customer_reviews.title: Great condition for renewed
customer_reviews.text: Can't tell the difference from a new product. Only frustration is with scanning directly to cloud storage services (One Drive, Google Drive), which is supposedly supported, but it's unclear how to enable it through the iOS app or the scanner interface.
customer_reviews.author: JamesDM

customer_reviews.title: Lack of a one-button scan ruins the experience
customer_reviews.text: The scan functionality of the ADS-1700W is great. It scans quickly and the image quality is excellent. But the experience is ruined by poorly designed software. What's the one thing I do most often? Initiate a scan from the printer. How many buttons should I have to press to do that? Clearly one. How many must I press? Two. Worse, there is a one to two-second delay after pressing the first button. I feel as though my life is being stolen away one second at a time. I contacted Brother's tech support about this issue and they confirmed that is not possible to initiate a scan by pressing a single button.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wildavsky

customer_reviews.title: Will not scan photos and no support.
customer_reviews.text: This machine will not scan my photos. No matter how I change the settings, it will scan the writing on the back of the photos but not the photograph itself. I've uninstalled drivers and software and reinstalled them. There is nothing on Brother's support pages addressing this issue and it is impossible to find a phone number to call them. It is frustrating to the extent I've spent several hours online, with the machine and software but still cannot remedy this. Brother is no where to be found on this topic for help. I purchased this scanner for the sole purpose of scanning in family photos. Very disappointed. tedkbrown@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: 1. Cannot trust reviews here and more importantly DO NOT trust reviews from the major websites - including pc mag, cnet etc 2. Could not get the scanner software install with cable attached - i had to do it wirelessly and waster like 2 hrs doing all kinds of things to my computer. I wish i knew this. 3. After finally installing, I put in some 20 papers to scan duplex, it swallowed 3-4 pages at once and started jamming. I am fuming ....brother sucks. Going back to Fujitsu
customer_reviews.author: RAMBO

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this refurbished model of Brother ADS1700W
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 out of 2 products dead or failed on arrival. The first unit - would pass one sheet through and immediately declare a "Paper jam" error - even though the single sheet had been passed completely through. The second unit -was totally DOA - wouldnt even power up. Amazon/Brother - Product Manager - you really need to look into whats going on - how these defective units are going through. This is not a software issue - this is pure hardware failure, that I have never experience before when buying from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Partha Srinivasan

customer_reviews.title: The iPrint and Scan software states that ADS1700W is not supported
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this to work. I spent hours with tech support. I downloaded iprintand scan software from Brother's website. It is half a GB. It would not let me choose the ADS 1700W and had a line that stated that the ADS 1700W was not supported by this software.
customer_reviews.author: DRJ

customer_reviews.title: Really works great.
customer_reviews.text: It isn't perfect, I can't do much with multiple pages, it wants to take them all at once, but I am doing letters, so have to do small amounts anyway. I kind of forgot to put them in facing down and so I have a bunch of things that are upside down, but can turn them over on my computer. I have folders of old letters and binders of journals, and bins of photos and histories, this will clear up a lot of space that they are taking. Will store on my computer and a thumb drive. I am happy for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scanner
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice scanner, easy to set up and the software is great because you can create a workflow and save/customize your usual scan settings. The only things I don't like are that it seems to pull more than one page through most times (I don't think I'm overloading it?) and I don't like that you can't add more pages to the scan. (Unless it does and I just haven't found the feature.) Other than that it is a decent portable option.
customer_reviews.author: Laura J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great fast, small footprint scanner
customer_reviews.text: I really like the small size of this scanner, but it has big scanner capability. Excellent quality. Fast! Easy to setup and use. Love the duplex scanning and you can turn it on and off easily. It would be nice if the cable came with the scanner, but I needed a longer cable than the usual 6 feet so that was okay. I would buy this scanner again and recommend for home use. The 20 page limit is not a big deal in the home environment. Super easy to remove paper jams simply by swinging the top open.
customer_reviews.author: Scissortail

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished Failure
customer_reviews.text: This scanner would not feed any sheets through straight. It jammed on every try. Amazon was great as always and refunded the money. I have a ADS-1500W and that one was also purchased refurbished and is working great. So maybe it was just a fluke. Purchased another 1500 and will stay away from the 1700.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but not always straight.
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect for my use. I use it to archive documents and receipts, both black and white and color. The wifi was easy to set up (compared to another Brothers model without the screen that never worked), and keeps my workspace clutter free. The only con for me was that the document feeder doesn't always keep documents straight. Sometimes the docs would be scanned slanted and I'd have to re-scan them. Folded letters also take some finessing to not be all clumped into a single document.
customer_reviews.author: jch

customer_reviews.title: Comparable ADS-1500 scanner upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I'd previously purchased two ADS-1500 Brother scanners, one kept at work and given away on retiring, the other for home office use also given away pursuant to downsizing before moving to retirement domicile. The specification promise of documents longer than 14" was an important attraction of the ADS-1700 but was sadly not delivered. That the newer foldaway paper guides don't snap into place is problematic for the ham fisted among us. The clam shell closure seems more sturdy than its predecessor. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Swish

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Clear image. Easy installation via wifi
customer_reviews.text: Great! Easy to install and connect to wifi both on computer and cell phone. I do my scanning with cell phone. That easy and very fast. When placing paper you'll notice it will need to be placed upside down and front facing away from you. Just try a few and you'll understand what I'm saying. Otherwise a great buy. Plus it does double sided smoothly as well. Cool!
customer_reviews.author: CREYCREY

customer_reviews.title: GREAT scanner, but...
customer_reviews.text: When it says 'one button scanning' that's simply not true. Its about 3 or 4 "buttons" on the scanner itself to scan ONE page. I was hoping to sit at the scanner--it wireless after all, with a pile of paper and hit ONE button to scan. What was I thinking? Other than that, this is a great scanner...I have 3 each a newer model than the last. If it had a true one button scan, it would get 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wooldridge-Azhar

customer_reviews.title: Speed and Accuracy.  Love BR-RECEIPTS
customer_reviews.text: First of all I had a real hard time figuring out BR-Receipts software download. But after I got it installed It's better than I expected. Just wish it came preloaded in machine. This machine probably does way more than I can ever use but bottom line I finally found something to replace Neat receipts. They got greedy stop making desktop software. Thank you Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: It was small and compact which are both pluses but it was very slow and the software was very outdated and not good for scanning simple things such as receipts. (even though I think that was one thing Brother promotes for this scanner). Not worth trying to work with it...sent it back. Ended up keeping my 15-year-old Fujitsu ScanSnap.
customer_reviews.author: Trimaniac

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Constantly disconnects. Have had to install and uninstall at least a half dozen times. The small windows where it worked I was hopeful. But overall I would no recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Brother scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great for scanning 14" documents that don't fit into flat bed scanners. Even has a feature to scan business cards without having to reset the document feeder. Perfect reproductions. Documents can be be scanned front/back in one single passing. Documents can be saved in various formats. Terrific bargain for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I use the scanner to convert the myrid of pictures my parents had and convert them to digital images. Easy to use and pretty fast. It doesn't work well with newspaper clippings, but with regular printer paper, it's great. So make a copy of the newspaper article and scan the copy.
customer_reviews.author: Howard2374

customer_reviews.title: What a brother...
customer_reviews.text: After couple a time working..and software didn't work properly anymore. So reinstall all the software they provide, but not working. - on my pc scanned page couldn't be saved the scanned document, when I clicked the save to pc, the software is just closed and nothing saved.
customer_reviews.author: Myounghee seo

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Scanner instructions are very poorly written. You need a usb to usb cable to setup yet one is not provided with the scanner. I could not get scanner to work kept getting error message remove jammed card- however there was no jammed card! I would not buy if you have a Mac computer. Brother provides no technical support on Saturdays which is a joke
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is unbelievable slow, the job that I do in one hour on a different scanner takes me 3+ with this one. is a paper jammer, and a time waister I am glad I was able to return it. I returned and ordered an epson 320 more money, but it’s serving as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.verygood

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Software Install
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't install Brother software on Windows 10. "Failed to Decompress to Archive" error message kept coming up. After hours of troubleshooting and an hour on the phone with Brother support I gave up. The tech support at Brother did give it a good try, just couldn't get it done.
customer_reviews.author: Ridetrooper

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This document scanner was just what I needed. It’s easy to carry from place to place. I wasn’t quiet crazy about the setup of downloading though. After getting passed the setup it was easy sailing from there. Ideal for business and home offices.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Really good for a small scanner
customer_reviews.text: Connected to my network without any problems. It has many features you expect from large business scanners. The web interface made configuration very easy. Scans fast. Saving to the network takes a little longer but it works well. Given its size and features, it is a great little scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Reduce that stack of paper in a hurry.
customer_reviews.text: Scans much much faster than my older ADS 1500 scanner. Only downside is that the ADS series apparently have a proprietary command set, so getting something like Hamrick Software’s VueScan is out of the question (will not be supported according to company).
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Engineer

customer_reviews.title: BROTHER SCANNER SOFTWARE UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT DO THE NEWEST VERSION OF THE SCANNER SOFTWARE - DISASTER. I ALSO HAD THE SAME RESULTS WITH ANOTHER BROTHER ALL-IN-ONE WHEN THE SCANNER UPDATE CAME IN - SCREWED EVERYTHING UP. I HAVE SENT 2 REQUESTS TO BROTHER FOR ASSISTANCE - NO REPLYS!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: I needed a scanner that could handle multiple pages. First, there are no instructions nor does it come with a cable to connect to the PC. It was impossible to get the scanner and computer to connect via WIFI leaving the only option to use a thumb-drive. When I finally got it to work it did not come with insructions to load the pages. After multiple tries I realized the papers had to be sorted from last to first and put in upside down. For more than $200 this machine should have had instructions, been easy to connect and should have included a USB cord. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Cleghorn

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I am not at all tech savvy but was able to get this going with no problems. It's a great little scanner. I have been scanning documents and pictures and it's been doing a great job. I am happy with this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: T. Winzent

customer_reviews.title: Compact design with OK software and image quality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Compact with modern design, folds up nicely for storage - Touch screen Cons: - Folder paper from letters jammed easily - Image quality was OK - older Scansnap s1500 yielded sharped and more solid results - OCR software and bundled scan software cumbersome and not straightforward - Not related to the product but Amazon delivery qA
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Small and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how compact and how fast this scanner is. I love that the software lets me control it from the computer and post scanned documents directly to the appropriate folder with the workflow.
customer_reviews.author: sdreader

customer_reviews.title: Feeder failure
customer_reviews.text: Unable to put a stack of 5 papers into feeder and have them go through one at a time. Either takes none or takes more than one at a time. Also pulls papers through crooked so the PDF is crooked. Machine eats significant time due to it being extremely finicky with the document feed. There is no document catcher, so it has to be put somewhere convenient for papers to land.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. VK

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner. It's even portable.
customer_reviews.text: The scanner so fast that has made the onerous task of scanning receipts, monthly, almost easy. I've even dropped it into a canvas bag and used it as a portable scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Will not scan multiple documents
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the sole purpose of scanning multipage documents on a business trip and it jammed EVERY SINGLE TIME. Ended up just using an app on our phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Runner

customer_reviews.title: Husband's new toy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. He likes to keep all his documents in an organized fashion and this machine is helping him doing that super easily.
customer_reviews.author: Pavs

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am having a ball scanning and shredding my old paperwork. The scanner is fast and feeds well, quality of the scans is good, the software is easy. Setup was easy --- I directly connected the scanner to my Mac laptop via USB (so probably avoided some of the issues other have hit).
customer_reviews.author: Andrea F

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: I like this scanner. If you're planning to plug it into your computer (as opposed to wireless), you'll need to buy an HDMI cable as well. It is not included. I don't think setting it up was "super easy", but we managed to get it. Quality seems good and scanning image is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Helt

customer_reviews.title: Great for doc scan, not photo scan
customer_reviews.text: Great for doc scan, but only adequate for photo scan.
customer_reviews.author: exgypsee

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Reliable, Easy
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to use for work as there are several documents that need to be scanned into the database. It’s fast and easy to use. Well worth every dollar. It is wireless so all you have to do is plug it in for power. Does front/back and multiple pages at a time.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Very SLOW Processing of scanned files to PC and not always successful
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the files went flying through this scanner while scanning, but... the time it takes to actually process the data and transfer it to my PC is very slow. I set it up through WiFi, not without any issues and several spent hours to do it; NOT happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this scanner everyday for school. Works great and he hasn’t had any issues. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Decent scanner but does have issues with multiple sheets of paper
customer_reviews.text: The quality is okay when if you are doing a bigger document packet, it tends to sometimes shift the paper feeding into the scanner and makes the images angled.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stiles

customer_reviews.title: nice little scanner
customer_reviews.text: have only had this for a few weeks but am liking it very much. easy to set up and makes great scans. happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: poulie and moolie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software; could not set up.
customer_reviews.text: Spent an evening trying to set this up but could not make it work. Brother's site is not helpful at all and there is nowhere to call. I should have known better than to buy this scanner because the scanner in my Brother Laser printer broke after a few uses. Incredibly frustrating to drop a couple of hundred bucks on such a poorly designed product. I have no idea why Amazon recommends this.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W. Desmond

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for working from home
customer_reviews.text: I love the brother product line and this is a great addition to my black & white brother printer for working from home.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this the other day and so far I’m pretty impressed! I consider myself a little technically challenged but this was actually not too bad to set up. I had a couple hiccups and it took me a little over an hour to figure it out but I DID it! It scans quickly and efficiently. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what the other issues are on the poor reviews. I set it all up and scanned within 5 minutes to my computer wirelessly! Very easy to set up and so far, I am satisfied with the scans. Good device for the money!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in the scanner, connected to the wireless network, installed the PC host utility, and began scanning flawlessly. Very easy setup, and easy to use. Produces quality scans. Would definitely recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: If you are using an MAC and running Catalina level of the operating system you must obtain the latest level of the driver/utilities
customer_reviews.author: j33s

customer_reviews.title: Great small scanner
customer_reviews.text: I've wasted money on small scanners in the past only to find a scanning app on my phone is better. This Brother scanner is exactly what I wanted: fast, small form factor, and 2-sided.
customer_reviews.author: awrench2torque

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is so easy to use with my smartphone! The scanner is very easy to use and fast. The only drawback I had was that some of the pages don’t scan with clean margins and can be a little off-center, but it’s probably because it’s a very small machine and so the pages are harder to align when you have multiple pages.
customer_reviews.author: I Wodarczyk

customer_reviews.title: This this is fast at double-sided scanning.
customer_reviews.text: Like how you can turn to a multipage PDF, word doc, image, etc. Be sure when you are sending it through, do it front-face down, and upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Snug Secure Case
customer_reviews.text: Like the headline: perfect fit, appears sturdy, handle is handy [ ;-)] Protects the scanner and AC adapter. There is also room for the USB cable too!
customer_reviews.author: CappyCaffeine

customer_reviews.title: Love the laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I got the laser Brother printer instead and I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbadoright

customer_reviews.title: Great value for fast speed scanning
customer_reviews.text: Compact and very fast. A great value for all the functional capability
customer_reviews.author: Waterwahoo

customer_reviews.title: Good performer
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected. Fast double sided scanning (with one pass). Brother iScan software works well once you figure out the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Only works for super small scan jobs
customer_reviews.text: It worked well at first. Now scanning up to only 5 pages causes jams and pages get skipped. I've used it for just a month and for small scan jobs. Works well for one or two pages at once maximum.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: It will not work
customer_reviews.text: I have to send this back due to it not going to work for me. I need something that will be TWAIN compatible with our EHR system we use.
customer_reviews.author: Pennyrile Nephrology

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost scanner
customer_reviews.text: Fast duplex scanning. Can use in pdf or jpeg format.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: So far excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to write a review since there were some dramatic reviews out there. It's been about a month. Not one unsuccessful scan. Software is good/very good. Set-up was easy. Very small footprint. Really helpful in my project of getting rid of paper and creating digital files.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast scanner ,worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Scanner is fast and the feed ramp never jammed. The interface was a bit confusing but the scanner connected wireless with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin G.

customer_reviews.title: Unanticipated expens.
customer_reviews.text: Did not include the special USB cable needed to set up! THAT COST ME AN EXTRA 27$.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Boardman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it works great. Scans IDs fast and it’s a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size and works well.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and the person said they really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: merryl dickson

customer_reviews.title: TOO many errors
customer_reviews.text: I usually scan multiple pages, the feeder doesn't work well and the software when it does work indicates there is an error and then you have to re-scan. It takes 3 times minimum to scan every document.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & Fast
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to use, scanned an entire file cabinet to a thumb drive in a few hours. Very fast scanning.
customer_reviews.author: C. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Unfixable Paper Jam
customer_reviews.text: I scanned two scans and then it said it had a paper jam. Several of us looked for the jam, we didn’t find one. All of the papers we ran through it were complete and not torn or missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This product would not work with either my laptop or PC. The installation instructions are useless. It is very flimsy and lightweight. If you do any volume of scanning, spend the money and buy a real scanner. This is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Snider

customer_reviews.title: Worked well except for the margin line
customer_reviews.text: The machine is easy to set up and operates quickly. I was forced to return my purchase, however, because of a vertical black stripe that ran along the right side of each of the scanned pages.
customer_reviews.author: Y. J. Bessent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. Perfect for my home office. Several settings that are easy to change. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. O'Regan

customer_reviews.title: Allowed us to arrive records fast into searchable pdf
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner, small footprint, fast, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Lost without you

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy too use. I very much liked the two sided scan capability.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: Its compact, easy to use and just right for home use.
customer_reviews.text: It's used to scan documents and other items to my computer. Love the size and easy of use.
customer_reviews.author: Annie mae

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Fast with clear scans - works well wired and wireless. Slight drawback - the side tabs to hold the pages upright are too small
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work after only 6 month
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this scanner for 6 months. Rarely used it in the beginning. Now that I need it, it won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this scanner sucked. Nothing was working properly. As for the price, too much for something that does not work..
customer_reviews.author: vc012

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: It works good for small scan jobs and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use, good quality scans
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this scanner a couple of times and every single time it jams and will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Scanning just made easier on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I find this scanner is cheaper and far more user friendly than my previous scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrii

customer_reviews.title: Works great !!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike, works great to use in my field office, my truck..........
customer_reviews.author: Lil Bill

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre scanner
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is I should have bought a Fuji Scansnap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Brother Wireless Document Scanner, ADS-1700W, Fast Scan Speeds, Easy-to-Use, Ideal for Home, Home Office or On-the-Go Professionals (ADS1700W), white
product_meta.description:
Style:New Model: ADS1700W

The Brother ADS-1700w compact desktop scanner offers fast document digitization, built-in wireless networking, and easy-to-use color Touchscreen. Scan stacks of double-sided, color and black and white documents up to 25ppm(1) in a single pass with 20-page capacity auto document feeder. The ADS-1700W scans documents, receipts and photos, plus business and plastic ID cards using a dedicated card slot. Scan to multiple destinations including File(2), OCR(2), Email, Network, FTP, Cloud services(7), Mobile Devices(3) and USB flash memory drive(4).

The ADS-1700W is ideal for home or on-the-go professionals and makes scanning easy with features that facilitate scanning including: programmable one-touch scanning that scans at the touch of a button; Auto Start Scan scans to pre-configured destinations; a dedicated card slot that lets you scan plastic cards; plus scan and retrieve files without having to install special software on the connected PC. The ADS-1700W is compatible with Windows, Mac and Linux as well as TWAIN, WIA, ICA, and SANE drivers(5). Includes a one-year limited warranty and free product lifetime online, call or live chat support.

(1)Color and monochrome scan speed, LTR at 300dpi. (2)When connected to a PC with applicable software. (3)Requires connection to wireless network. (4)USB flash memory drive sold separately. (5)Drivers and bundled software available via download on manufacturer’s website. Internet connection required. Refer to User Guide for more information. (6)Features dependent upon downloaded driver and software. Bundled document management programs downloaded separately on manufacturer’s website. Internet connection required. Refer to User Guide for more information. (7)When connected to a PC. Requires the Brother iPrint&Scan app, internet connection and account with desired cloud service. (8)Requires USB 3.0 compatible PC and cable (not included). (9)Requires mail server support. All referenced trademarks and registered trademarks are the property of their respective companies.
feature_bullets: COMPACT DESIGN AND FAST SCAN SPEEDS HANDLE A VARIETY OF DOCUMENTS - Scan single and double-sided, documents in a single pass at up to 25 ppm(1). Easily scan documents up to 34” long, receipts and photos using the 20-page capacity auto document feeder.

EASY-TO-USE AND SAVES TIMES - 2.8” color Touchscreen display for one-touch scanning to preset destinations and device settings management. Auto Start Scan lets you simply drop paper into the feeder to initiate auto scanning to a predefined profile.

COMPATIBLE WITH THE WAY YOU WORK - ADS1700W supports multiple “Scan-to” destinations: File(2), OCR(2), Email(2), Network, FTP, Cloud services(7) Mobile Devices(3) and USB flash memory drive(4) to help optimize your business process.

VERSATILE SCANNING AND CONNECTIVITY - Wireless scanning to PC, cloud apps(7), mobile(3) and network destinations plus Micro USB 3.0 interface for local connections. Dedicated card slot easily scans business and photo ID cards.

OPTIMIZE IMAGES AND TEXT - Enhance scans with automatic color detection/adjustment, image rotation (PC only), bleed through prevention / background removal, text enhancement, color drop. Software suite(6) includes document management and OCR software.
